00031 typedef int status_t;

00034 // Check if Linux 2.6 header files already define these types
00035 #ifndef  __BIT_TYPES_DEFINED__
00036 typedef unsigned char  uint8_t;
00037 typedef unsigned short uint16_t;
00038 typedef unsigned int   uint32_t;
00039 #endif
00040 
00041 
00042 /* These are Windows types (used in some shared files) so define them
00043  * when not on a Windows platform.
00044  */
00045 typedef unsigned char  UCHAR;
00046 typedef unsigned short USHORT;
00047 typedef unsigned long  ULONG;
00048 
00049 #ifndef __cplusplus 
00050 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < KERNEL_VERSION(2,6,23))

00052 #endif

00073 /*============ Unsupported Functions in Linux =============*/
00074 
00075 // Windows Sleep() is in milliseconds
00076 // Linux has a usleep() which is microseconds
00077 #define Sleep(a) usleep(a * 1000)
00078 
00079 
00080 
00081 // Port some Windows concepts to Linux
00082 typedef int HANDLE;
00083 #define GUID char
